CONJUGATES: spearheads (n. plural) | spearheads (v. 3rd person singular present) | spearheading (v. present participle) | spearheaded (v. past tense, past participle)
ETYMOLOGY: From the compound of 'spear' and 'head'. Originally referring to the tip of a spear (late 19th century), then extended figuratively to mean the leading person or group in an attack or movement (early 20th century). The verb form emerged around the same time as the figurative noun.
SINCE: Early 20th century (for figurative and verb usage)

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The leading person, group, or force in an attack, movement, or campaign.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 进攻、运动或战役中的先锋、前锋或领导力量。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The new research team became the spearhead of the company's innovation efforts.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这个新的研究团队成为了公司创新工作的先锋。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To lead an attack, movement, or campaign.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 领导、率先发起（进攻、运动或战役）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She was chosen to spearhead the new fundraising initiative.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她被选中来领导这项新的募捐活动。
